ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Rachel Mak
Rachel Mak
Rachel Mak
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal Nassar
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Very passive in his approach to teaching
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  N/A
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal and Rachel Mak

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The professors are great. However, I would find the course more helpful if how the theories in industrial ecology were practiced in the real world could have been discussed more.

The material was interesting and the instruction was clear. I would have valued learning and practicing more technical skills as part of this course. Another MFA assignment or input-output analysis assignment would have been useful.
N/A
I loved this course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: A systematic view of industrial ecology theories and development in academia.
Out of class assignments and readings
Project, debates
The best aspect of this course was the opportunity to apply our learning through work with an actual client for the final group project.
All the new concepts one gets to learn and assignments/exercises are really useful.
Practical elements like the homework assignments
Good overview course that would be much enriched by hands on technical application of tools, a big oversight given the professional focus of the school
The opportunity to develop a broad understanding of IE was interesting and valuable.
-Debates-Long Term project
The group project was the part I learned the most from. And hearing from other students' projects was equally engaging and exciting.
The lectures.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Out-of-date and/or repetitive slides. Many were the same from CEMS. Lectures were also way too slow without enough detailed content. Felt more like high school than grad school level.

I understand the need for a practical aspect of the course. Yet, some of the projects fall under the lets-get-this-over-with category, which defeats the purpose. I believe people in general were more interested in getting to know the tools a little better rather than having to do a project. Project satisfaction also hinges on level of commitment with classmates, which is highly unpredictable and predictably inconsistent, given the amount of work needed for this and many other projects during the semester.
lectures

Examples. Same examples were used again and again to explain different concepts. Many concepts/topics were repeated way too many times. Every class, every topic and slide must be new. So many diagrams and topics were repeated more than once.More real life examples of who is using these concepts and for what, to take what kind of decisions at national level, legal level, political level and to address business risks, if covered, would make class more interesting.
More consistent application of software tools throughout the course,
The lectures were sometimes slow and redundant. A more interactive teaching approach may have been valuable.

The concepts presented in the lecture were all interesting and usually for students who would like to focus on Industrial Ecology. However, since this is a graduate level course would have appreciated more opportunities to learn and practice the tools presented in these lectures including modeling, forecasting, etc. Not many classes, other than LCA, are offered that would impart these skills. The MFA and LCA assignments were beneficial and would hope for more of those types of assignments.

Communication about the group projects was fractured and incomplete, and we found ourselves pretty much alone in the planning process. For our project things needed to move faster than our TF was willing to move, so we had to take things upon ourselves and hope they worked out, which thankfully they did.
The flow from one lecture to the next.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The relationship between the class lectures and the two labs were useful but a bit too fast. There was a fair amount of lab time spent on figuring out how the programs worked, which could have been better introduced in class.

The computer lab components were great introductions but could have been furthered with continued assignments of the sort. The reaction papers could be done away with entirely. Software technical components should be reinforced for people attempting to enter the field
N/A

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Very passive, non present, generally unapproachableLikewise, Rachel Mak, passive and non present
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  A little dense, technical, and disconnected when lecturing. Knows the material quite well, but went into the weeds in a hurry.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal and Rachel provided thoughtful commentary on our work. They were both very accessible and available.

Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal certainly challenged students with his lab and lectures and found his contribution to the class very helpful. I would suggest however for lectures and assignments he managed to present smaller amounts of information to allow students to better process.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  I didn't interact with Nedal or Rachel enough to answer this question

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Industrial Ecology is increasingly relevant to almost every field taught at FES, however, most people are not aware of it. I was aware it was relevant but I was blown away by the its high degree of relevance. This course needs to be much better promoted.
I am interested in industrial ecology. It is my program.
Yes. The concepts covered in the course are very useful.
Extremely relevant
I am interested in sustainable business operations, industrial ecology, and food systems.
This is exactly what I'm interested in.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See Q20
I was looking for an overview of IE and wanted to determine if it's an area I'd like to explore more deeply. I found many of the concepts and tools we learned to be very compelling.
It is in an area of study that interests me.
This is exactly what I'm interested in.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Not really. I find it hard to relate many of what I have learned from the course to real world problems.
Not particularly. The class was way more of an academic look at IE, rather than giving us a practical applied skill set or tools to bring into companies.
I would have rather worked with more Industrial Ecology tools rather than working on a project.

Lecture could have been more stimulating. I would also have enjoyed more in class discussion. I felt that the readings were rehashed in lecture. If we all read them we should have been able to extend the conversation and learn more in class without the need to reiterate everything we had just read. A summary could have been provided in power point form to accomplish that purpose.

Even though I do not plan on conducting many LCAs or MFAs in my career, I found the systems-thinking approach to industrial ecology particularly useful. Beyond the industrial ecology tools, the concepts I learned far exceeded my expectations for the course.
It was an ok introduction to the topic that should have had greater technical focus
More or less. I would have valued more technical skill building with assignments that focused on practicing MFA, LCA, EIO etc more fully.
I was more than satisfied with the learning opportunity offered by this course. It really exceeded my expectations.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: disadvantage-Lots of administrative time. hard to coordinate schedules Advantages-Opportunity to bounce ideas and perform more research than would have been possible in an individual project.

The advantages of the group work were that students came to the course with vastly different backgrounds and familiarity with the labs and ways of conducting analysis. Thus, roles could divided accordingly with everyone playing to their strengths but also learning from one another.The disadvantage, per usual, was some group members not putting in as much time as others.
Very useful.
This was a very valuable aspect of the course. I enjoy learning from my classmates and discovering how our skills are diverse and complementary.
We learned a lot from one another and were able to accomplish a significant project that would have taken much longer if conducted by just one of us.
Only one group for teh entire semester so not a lot of experience working with different types of people.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Academic, rather than applied. Pretty easy.
I would suggest it. Get started early on the group project and be sure that your group members are passionate about the topic
Go for it! Work hard and you will enjoy this class.
Take the course.
